intro: Flaveria floridana, commonly known as Florida ironweed, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as roadsides and disturbed soils. It produces bright yellow flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. Its slender stems and hairy leaves are adaptations to its native environment, allowing it to thrive in various soil conditions.
